page.title: 15Home Life, St Ives
page.content:
Home life in St Ives, in common with the rest of the country, has undergone a tremendous change in the last few decades.
With the advent of technology most homes have many labour saving devices, particularly those used by the housewife. These have become necessary because more women go out to work now than was the case. Baby minders and playgroups are readily available meaning that women are no longer tied to the house by children. This has brought about greater independence for women as well as helping the families to buy homes of their own. The home life of children has also changed dramatically. They no longer need to make their own entertainment as most houses have one or two TV sets and a video recorder.
